States that electrons are uniformly distributed in an atom.

subAns.Column 1: Indicates that the atom is spherical in shape.

questions.questionsTitle: What must be the temperature m Fahrenheit so that it will be twice its value in Celsius?

subQuestion.question: What must be the temperature m Fahrenheit so that it will be twice its value in Celsius?
subQuestion.ans: `F = 9/5  C + 32`We are given that the Fahrenheit temperature should be twice the Celsius temperature: F = 2C`2C = 9/5 C + 32`To eliminate the fraction, multiply both sides of the equation by 5:`5xx2C = 5 xx (9/5C + 32)`10C = 9C + 16010C − 9C = 160C = 160Now that we know C = 160, substitute this value into the equation F = 2C:F = 2 × 160= 320°F

questions.questionsTitle: A bridge is made from 20 m long iron rods. At temperature 18∘C, the distance between two rods in 0.4 cm. Up to what temperature will the bridge be in good shape?

subQuestion.question: A bridge is made from 20 m long iron rods. At temperature 18∘C, the distance between two rods in 0.4 cm. Up to what temperature will the bridge be in good shape?
subQuestion.ans: Length of the iron rod = 20 m = 2000 cm at 18∘CDistance between the length of two rods, = 0.4 cmTemperature coefficient of linear expansion of iron = 11.5 × 10-6°C-1The bridge will be in good shape till both the rods expand by 0.2 cm as the temperature is increased.

questions.questionsTitle: At 15∘C the height of Eifel tower is 324 m. If it is made of iron, what will be the increase in length in cm, at 30∘C?

subQuestion.question: At 15∘C the height of Eifel tower is 324 m. If it is made of iron, what will be the increase in length in cm, at 30∘C?
subQuestion.ans: Height of Eifel tower = 324 m = 32400 cm at 15∘CTemperature coefficient of linear expansion of iron = 11.5 × 10-6°C-1Change in temperature = 30∘C − 15∘C = 15∘CChange in length = ΔlUsing formula for linear expansion of solids, we have`(triangle l)/l = α_l triangle "T"``=> (triangle l)/32400 = 11.5 xx 10^(-6) xx 15``triangle l = 32400 xx 11.5 xx 10^(-6) xx 15`= 5.6 cm

questions.questionsTitle: Two substances A and B have specific heats c and 2 c respectively. If A and B are given Q and 4Q amounts of heat respectively, the change in their temperatures is the same. If the mass of A is m, what is the mass of B?

subQuestion.question: Two substances A and B have specific heats c and 2 c respectively. If A and B are given Q and 4Q amounts of heat respectively, the change in their temperatures is the same. If the mass of A is m, what is the mass of B?
subQuestion.ans: Let the mass of B = M.Let the change in temperature be T for both the bodies, A and B.The amount of heat in a body is given asQ = m × c × Δ TFor body A,Q=m×c×T`=> "T" = "Q"/("mc")`    ...(i)For body B,4Q=M×2c×T`=> "M" = (4"Q")/(2"c" xx "T")`From (i), T = `Q/(mc)``=> "M" = (4Q)/(2c xx Q/(mc)) = 2m`

questions.questionsTitle: When a substance having mass 3 kg receives 600 cal of heat, its temperature increases by 10∘C. What is the specific heat of the substance?

subQuestion.question: When a substance having mass 3 kg receives 600 cal of heat, its temperature increases by 10∘C. What is the specific heat of the substance?
subQuestion.ans: Let the specific heat capacity of the substance be c.Given:Mass of the substance, m = 3 kg = 3000 gHeat given to the substance, Q = 600 calIncrease in temperature of the substance = 10∘CNow, the amount of heat in a body is given as`"Q" = "m" xx "c" xx triangle "T"``=> "c" = "Q"/("m" xx triangle "T") = 600/(3000 xx 10) = 0.02  "cal"  g^(-1) ° C^(-1)`

questions.questionsTitle: Study the following incident.

subQuestion.question: Explain the reason for the blurring of the images to Swara by answering the following questions.
subQuestion.ans: Yes, there is a relation between the reflection of light and blurring of the images.

subQuestion.question: Is there a relation between the reflection of light and the blurring of the images?
subQuestion.ans:
Initially, the water was still and its surface was smooth.
Thus, regular type of reflection was taking place from its surface i.e.
all the light rays coming from Swara's body or Yash's body reflected in the same direction on hitting the water surface and reached our eyes.
Because of this, we saw a clear image.But when Yash threw a stone in the water, the water surface became rough due to which irregular type of reflection of light occurred on its surface i.e all the light rays coming from Swara's body or Yash's body reflected in different directions on hitting the water surface.
Thus, only some part of the reflected rays reached our eyes.
Because of this, we see a blurred image.

questions.questionsTitle: What must be the temperature in Fahrenheit so that it will be twice its value in Celsius?

subQuestion.question: What must be the temperature in Fahrenheit so that it will be twice its value in Celsius?
subQuestion.ans: Let the temperature in Celsius be T.So, the temperature in Fahrenheit = 2TNow,F = 32 + `9/5` C      ...(formula)⇒ 2T = 32 + `9/5` TMultiply both sides by 5,10T = 160 + 9T10T − 9T = 160T = 160°TemperatureinFahrenheit= 2T= 2 × 160= 320°∴ The temperature in Fahrenheit that is twice its value in Celsius is  320°.

questions.questionsTitle: A bridge is made from 20 m long iron rods. At temperature 18∘C, the distance between two rods in 0.4 cm. Up to what temperature will the bridge be in good shape?

subQuestion.question: A bridge is made from 20 m long iron rods. At temperature 18∘C, the distance between two rods in 0.4 cm. Up to what temperature will the bridge be in good shape?
subQuestion.ans: Length of the iron rod = 20 m = 2000 cm at 18∘CDistance between the length of two rods, = 0.4 cmTemperature coefficient of linear expansion of iron = 11.5 × 10-6°C-1The bridge will be in good shape till both the rods expand by 0.2 cm as the temperature is increased.

questions.questionsTitle: At 15∘C the height of Eifel tower is 324 m. If it is made of iron, what will be the increase in length in cm, at 30∘C?

subQuestion.question: At 15∘C the height of Eifel tower is 324 m. If it is made of iron, what will be the increase in length in cm, at 30∘C?
subQuestion.ans: Height of Eifel tower = 324 m = 32400 cm at 15∘CTemperature coefficient of linear expansion of iron = 11.5 × 10-6°C-1Change in temperature = 30∘C − 15∘C = 15∘CChange in length = ΔlUsing formula for linear expansion of solids, we have`(triangle l)/l = α_l triangle "T"``=> (triangle l)/32400 = 11.5 xx 10^(-6) xx 15``triangle l = 32400 xx 11.5 xx 10^(-6) xx 15`= 5.6 cm

questions.questionsTitle: Two substances A and B have specific heats c and 2 c respectively. If A and B are given Q and 4Q amounts of heat respectively, the change in their temperatures is the same. If the mass of A is m, what is the mass of B?

subQuestion.question: Two substances A and B have specific heats c and 2 c respectively. If A and B are given Q and 4Q amounts of heat respectively, the change in their temperatures is the same. If the mass of A is m, what is the mass of B?
subQuestion.ans: Let the mass of B = M.Let the change in temperature be T for both the bodies, A and B.The amount of heat in a body is given asQ = m × c × Δ TFor body A,Q=m×c×T`=> "T" = "Q"/("mc")`    ...(i)For body B,4Q=M×2c×T`=> "M" = (4"Q")/(2"c" xx "T")`From (i), T = `Q/(mc)``=> "M" = (4Q)/(2c xx Q/(mc)) = 2m`

questions.questionsTitle: When a substance having mass 3 kg receives 600 cal of heat, its temperature increases by 10∘C. What is the specific heat of the substance?

subQuestion.question: When a substance having mass 3 kg receives 600 cal of heat, its temperature increases by 10∘C. What is the specific heat of the substance?
subQuestion.ans: Let the specific heat capacity of the substance be c.Given:Mass of the substance, m = 3 kg = 3000 gHeat given to the substance, Q = 600 calIncrease in temperature of the substance = 10∘CNow, the amount of heat in a body is given as`"Q" = "m" xx "c" xx triangle "T"``=> "c" = "Q"/("m" xx triangle "T") = 600/(3000 xx 10) = 0.02  "cal"  g^(-1) ° C^(-1)`

questions.questionsTitle: Study the following incident.

subQuestion.question: Explain the reason for the blurring of the images to Swara by answering the following questions.
subQuestion.ans: Yes, there is a relation between the reflection of light and blurring of the images.

subQuestion.question: Is there a relation between the reflection of light and the blurring of the images?
subQuestion.ans:
Initially, the water was still and its surface was smooth.
Thus, regular type of reflection was taking place from its surface i.e.
all the light rays coming from Swara's body or Yash's body reflected in the same direction on hitting the water surface and reached our eyes.
Because of this, we saw a clear image.But when Yash threw a stone in the water, the water surface became rough due to which irregular type of reflection of light occurred on its surface i.e all the light rays coming from Swara's body or Yash's body reflected in different directions on hitting the water surface.
Thus, only some part of the reflected rays reached our eyes.
Because of this, we see a blurred image.

subQuestion.question: Which types of reflection of light can you notice from this?
subQuestion.ans: Yes, laws of reflection are followed in both types of reflection.
